key_channel_insights.line_content: More than 91% of OTA prices were found to be higher than those on Kenya Airways' website, reflecting limited competitive pricing.
MSE consistently matched the airline's own prices 72% of the time, while 28% were competitively lower, indicating effective pricing strategies.
GDS prices were higher 95.59% of the time compared to Kenya Airways' website, highlighting issues with competitiveness in this channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 91% of the pricing records showed that OTA prices were higher than the airline's own website across all dimensions.
The average price difference for OTA compared to the airline's website remains very small, with a decrease of -0.01% last week versus the previous weeks.
The frequency of OTA pricing maintaining the same status compared to the airline website saw only minor fluctuations, indicating stable market conditions.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 91.18% of all OTA transactions recorded pricing higher than the airline's site, with a price difference average of +0.07% last week.
Only 1.47% of OTA prices matched those on the airline's site, showing minimal competitive pricing amongst OTA offerings.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short Haul routes consistently reflected 91.18% of OTA prices being higher than the airline's site, reinforcing the need for strategic pricing adjustments.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For the KE origin group, OTA prices were also predominately higher, matching trends observed in the overall summary.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: The majority of OTA prices for close-in bookings were higher at 87.23%, indicating a potential area for competitive pricing strategies.
No variations were noted for far-out bookings, with all recorded prices exceeding those on the airline's website.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel exhibited a consistent pattern, with 72% of the fares being the same as those listed on the airline's website last week.
For short haul options, the channel offered lower pricing in 28% of instances, demonstrating competitive pricing strategies.
The percentage of fares lower on MSE has decreased by 11.72% from the previous month, indicating a reduction in competitive pricing.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Overall, 72% of MSE offers matched the airline's website rates, while 28% were lower. There was no instance of prices being higher on the MSE channel this week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Across all regions, 72% of fares matched the airline's website, while 28% were lower compared to the airline's direct offers.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For points of origin within KE, the MSE pricing reflected a similar scenario: 72% same and 28% lower compared to direct offers.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed 78% price matching with only 22% lower offers, while far-out bookings had 62% matched offers, indicating a more competitive edge closer to the departure date.

gds_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, GDS prices were higher 95.59% of the time compared to the airline's website.
Close-in bookings showed minor fluctuations with a slight increase in GDS pricing by 0.08% compared to the previous month.
The GDS channel did not exhibit lower pricing in the latest week, highlighting potential competitiveness issues.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: During the latest week, GDS pricing was higher than the airlineâ€™s website 95.59% of the time.
The same prices were observed in the GDS for 1.47% of the records during the latest week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS pricing for North America reflects a high discrepancy with 95.59% of offers priced higher than the airline's website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Pricing for bookings originating from Kenya exhibited a high frequency of higher GDS prices, impacting competitive positioning.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings demonstrated that 93.62% of offers in GDS are priced higher than the website, maintaining a consistent upward pricing trend.
For far-out bookings, GDS prices increased by 0.08% compared to last week, indicating potential market adjustments.
